messages: 5970bd1634756232824f68fe3b6bb725 (07:20): ever since i got this WRT54GS, the signal is as strong or stronger in dBm (don't know noise of course) but my wifi downstream has gone to crap
5970bd1634756232824f68fe3b6bb725 (07:21): i mean it's good, about 600 kbps but it was 10x that.
802d0d342354e267cf741a4886e9cf79 (07:21): imho, airgo's wireless chipsets are the best, but they aren't linux friendly.
5970bd1634756232824f68fe3b6bb725 (07:21): i dont know what kind of radio that belkin AP had in it.
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (07:23): make that like 12 miles actually
5970bd1634756232824f68fe3b6bb725 (07:24): J4k3: hey point that to the west, son!
5970bd1634756232824f68fe3b6bb725 (07:24): i dont knwo if there are any mountains between us but hey try it once
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (07:24): yeah, mountains screw with the tropo!
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (07:25): so check this insanity out
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (07:25): picked up a PC from this guy
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (07:25): says it crashes after like 5-10 minutes
5970bd1634756232824f68fe3b6bb725 (07:25): i shall most likely give to you the comraderie and emotional validation which you seek, my technobro-in-arms
5970bd1634756232824f68fe3b6bb725 (07:25): but for the asking

a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (07:25): its a shitty PSU, even the connectors were crap (shake the wires and it'd reboot)... but beyond that, I popped the heatsink off when I noticed white zinc on the mounting hardware
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (07:26): and literally
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (07:26): there was 3mm of cheap zinc shit
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (07:26): across the entire length of the heatsink
5970bd1634756232824f68fe3b6bb725 (07:26): what's that?  is that bad?
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (07:26): ... for a celeron/2.7
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (07:26): thermal grease
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (07:26): the cheap white thin crap
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (07:26): thats zinc
5970bd1634756232824f68fe3b6bb725 (07:26): 3mm is mega thick isn't it?
802d0d342354e267cf741a4886e9cf79 (07:26): real people use arctic silver.
f3dddede7cafdc2312155376d854dfa0 (07:26): J4k3: better than white phosphorus
802d0d342354e267cf741a4886e9cf79 (07:27): hahahaha white phosphorus
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (07:27): silentfury: it got reassembled with arctic alumina
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (07:27): actually
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (07:27): back in the 6x86 and K6 days
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (07:27): I used high temperature wheel bearing grease
5970bd1634756232824f68fe3b6bb725 (07:27): i have never dealt with cooling issues.  never had em afaik.
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (07:27): worked fine..
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (07:28): dtm: lucky.
802d0d342354e267cf741a4886e9cf79 (07:28): i don't deal with cooling issues either. then again i use 120mm fans.
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (07:28): some noob built this PC
5970bd1634756232824f68fe3b6bb725 (07:28): hooray for the noobs
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (07:28): but, I do wash heatsinks often
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (07:28): so I replace a lot of thermal grease in my life
802d0d342354e267cf741a4886e9cf79 (07:28): i'm trying to think of what would be the best backup solution for this friend of mine for her laptop.
802d0d342354e267cf741a4886e9cf79 (07:29): this maxtor onetouch drive won't allow a restore using a boot cd
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (07:30): XP or Linux?
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (07:30): I'm assuming XP
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (07:30): theres some $25-30 backup software for XP thats really nice
802d0d342354e267cf741a4886e9cf79 (07:30): what's it called
5970bd1634756232824f68fe3b6bb725 (07:32): 'iwconfig' tells me i'm at 18Mbps on 802.11g and yet speakeasy.net/speedtest says no more than 400-600 kbps down and 400 kbps up
5970bd1634756232824f68fe3b6bb725 (07:33): i'll try something inside the house alone, although i know the cable's 6Mbps
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (07:33): dtm: try pinging across the link with larger packets (1480 bytes)
5970bd1634756232824f68fe3b6bb725 (07:34): yeah i can even ping flood that pretty well
